SENT.plain: OBJECT: Transvenous embolization is an effective treatment for dural arterio-venous fistulas
In the event of dural sinus thrombosis, embolization can be performed by direct puncture via craniectomy
We report our experience with transcranial venous embolization in two patients
METHODS: Two patients underwent transcranial venous embolization of a type-III dural arterio-venous fistula of the transverse sinus
The craniectomy was performed with neuronavigation assistance
RESULTS: The surgical approach consisted in a minimal exposure of the sinus with a drill
Neuronavigation allowed accurate placement of the craniectomy
The endovascular treatment was performed in a second stage, enabling complete and stable occlusion of the fistula in both patients

CONCLUSION: This combined treatment of dural AVFs associating craniectomy and transcranial puncture of the sinus is simple and efficient when retrograde navigation through the internal jugular vein cannot be achieved
Neuronavigation is helpful in accurately positioning the craniectomy
